review: I purchased the Amazon Fire TV for use at a vacation home and in particular for use with Slingbox, a device that lets you send your home TV service over the internet to a mobile device , a computer or to a remote TV using the free SlingPlayer app on Fire TV. Fire TV was the only devise of its kind that has a SlingPlayer app. Without Fire TV  the only way to project my home TV service on to my TV at my vacation home is to use my IPhone as the receiving device and connect it to the TV with a HDMI cable. With Fire TV, which I plug directly into my internet router with an Ethernet cable I get a much stronger signal and a wireless remote to operate Slingbox on my remote TV.The Fire TV remote is excellent, especially the voice activated search feature which enables you to search for just about any content available in a flash without having to scroll through reams of screens and program guides.I also down loaded an app from the Fire TV app store that enables me to mirror anything on my IPhone on the TV screen, including photos, videos or anything appearing on my phone such as internet content that may not be available on the Fire TV.The Fire TV worked very smoothly and easily. I have not had enough time to try out all its features yet and if they all work as well as what I have tried I would give it five stars.
